title: Viña Casablanca 2015 Cefiro Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Band-Aid and baked red-fruit aromas set up a plump palate with creaminess. Candied smoky-berry flavors finish oaky and toasty, with enough true PN character to make this worthwhile.

title: Maison Nicolas 2015 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Scents of ripe red berry and cherry fruits are upfront on the nose of this friendly red, with hints of sweet spice, cherry cola, plum sauce and tree bark adding depth and interest. Lightweight and easy drinking, it boasts silky tannins and a fresh-fruited palate. Drink now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Lab Red (Lisboa)
description: With partial aging in wood, this is a spicy, smoky wine that is also full of ripe red fruits. Well-integrated tannins give shape to this wine. A crisp aftertaste and the wine is ready to drink.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca Red (Lisboa)
description: Packed with black fruits and balancing acidity, this easy-going wine is ready to drink. With black currant and berry flavor, it is soft and hints at a touch of toast.

title: Bodega Classica 2015 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Rosado (Rioja)
description: Slightly grassy aromas of melon and stone fruits lead to a tangy, citrusy palate. This tastes a touch bready and like a peach pit, while the finish follows suit with pithy bitterness.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Beaujo Chéri  (Beaujolais)
description: Soft and juicy, this is a bright cherry-flavored wine. It has a fine line of acidity to bring out the refreshing fruitiness and crisp aftertaste.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Bigode Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a soft, ripe and fruity wine. Smooth and lightly textured, its unusual blend of Pinot Noir, Shiraz and Castelão is generous and spicy with good final acidity. Drink now.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Rosé (Lisboa)
description: This is an off-dry wine, soft with a touch of tannin. It has some attractive acidity to keep it crisp as well as ripe red fruits. Drink now.

title: Tenuta San Giorgio 2014 Campoleto  (Rosso di Montalcino)
description: Aromas of French oak, strawberry and coconut carry over to the lean palate along with a note of coffee bean. Firm but fleeting tannins lead to a short, astringent finish.

title: Seacampo 2015 Casa Américo Rosé (Dão)
description: Lemon and raspberry flavored wine with crisp acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It has just a hint of tannin and a squeeze of lime at the end. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)
description: The wine has a rustic character that contrasts with the ripe tannins and red berry fruits. At three years, the wine is ready to drink with structure and fruitiness shadowed by the earthy aftertaste.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Terra de Lobos Red (Tejo)
description: The land of wolves, Terra de Lobos, is a dense, balanced wine that brings together acidity and fresh red berry fruits. The tannins are not aggressive, but are just enough to give the wine shape. Drink now.

title: Aila 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: This new brand belongs to Santa Ema, and its Leyda SB straddles the line between vegetal and green fruits, with a canned-bean scent rising to the top. Briny citrus and lightly vegetal flavors finish briny and salty.

title: Château Viranel 2015 Tradition Rosé (Saint-Chinian)
description: Made from 40% Grenache Noir, 40% Syrah and 20% Cinsault, this coppery rosé is freshly fruited and quite floral, with aromas of ripe stone fruit, strawberry and orange blossom. The palate is approachable and balanced, with ample acidity and a short but clean finish.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)
description: Light and fruity, the wine has a smooth edge that is cut with acidity. It is an immediately accessible wine with a lzesty lemon finish.

title: Diversion 2014 Majestic Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Green herb, flower, citrus and pencil lead aromas are followed by sweet plum flavors with lemony accents. Lightly grainy tannins round it out.

title: Domaine Bertrand 2015  Beaujolais-Villages
description: Lively, fruity and made to be drunk young, this is a crisp red-fruit-flavored wine. It has acidity and a tangy orange peel character. Drink now.

title: Domaine d'Arton 2015 Ysé Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Orange-pink in color, this is ripe, full rosé. It has plenty of acidity as well as a crisp texture. The weight of the wine puts its firmly in the food category of rosé.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: The herbal aromas leap from the glass in this crisp, green-fruit and citrus-flavored wine. It is tangy, herbal and grassy in character with a zesty texture and a tight mineral aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Haut-Marin Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: A blend that includes Gros Manseng along with Colombard and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is light as a feather—crisp and with just an edge of honey. It is lively with a herbal character that is refreshing and lightly perfumed.

title: Castello Tricerchi 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of stalky underbrush, wet earth and a whiff of truffle lift out of the glass. The simple, vivacious palate offers small red berries and a hint of mocha alongside vigorous acidity and frail tannins.

title: Beso de Vino 2015 Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Basic plum and black cherry aromas come with hints of baking spices and cinnamon. This feels a bit high in acidity and pinchy. While a quick wash of grapy, black-fruit flavors finishes without much noise.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2012 Viñas Viejas de Paniza Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Stalky, gritty, earthy plum aromas are minimally ripe. This feels firm, grabby, chunky and rough all in one. Gritty, unusually-bready berry flavors finish herbal and dry.

title: Bossy Boots 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)
description: Light on the nose, then fresh but a bit watery on the palate, this simple SB delivers undefined citrus flavors that lose steam in front of a quiet finish.

title: Caliterra 2014 Reserva Shiraz (Colchagua Valley)
description: High-toned cherry and floral notes blend with scents of plum and raspberry. This is narrow and jammy in feel, such that it collapses a bit. The preserved-berry flavors are more generic than specific.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)
description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and with hints of licorice and dark chocolate. The spice from the wood aging still shows strongly although that will integrate over the next few months. Drink this ripe wine from 2017.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Beaujolais
description: Light tannins give this wine an attractive texture. It has bright cherry fruits along with glittering acidity. It's a fruity, fresh wine that is ready to drink.

title: Laurent Perrachon 2015 Terre de Loyse  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This is a tight wine with red-currant fruits and plenty of acidity. It is crisp and very fresh, demanding a few more months to calm down. Drink from 2017.

title: Leyda 2014 Lot 5 Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)
description: This is another take-it-or-leave-it version of Lot 5. As per usual, it's an intense example of Leyda Valley Chardonnay, which means it's super briny and barely ripe. Blazing acidity creates a sense of sharpness, while saline-rich flavors of citrus and oak finish racy in that patented Chilean coastal way.

title: Loma Larga 2013 Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Briny aromas of citrus and chlorinated pool water dominate the nose. Flavors of corn and briny stone fruits are pushed by strong acidity on the finish. Otherwise, there's little else on offer.
